author: Rachel McRady
title: Kristi Yamaguchi Tells Nancy Kerrigan to 'Break a Leg' on 'DWTS' in Cringe-Worthy Tweet
text: Kristi Yamaguchi Tells Nancy Kerrigan to 'Break a Leg' on 'DWTS' in Cringe-Worthy Tweet by Rachel McRady 2:47 AM PDT, March 23, 2017 Photo: WireImage Eek! Kristi Yamaguchi tried lending her support to fellow professional ice skater Nancy Kerrigan earlier this week, but her poor choice of words caused a major stir on Twitter. WATCH: 'Dancing With the Stars' Host Tom Bergeron Wants to Make Peace Between William Shatner and Nick Viall Yamaguchi, who won Dancing With the Stars in 2008, sent a tweet to current contestant Kerrigan, writing, ‚ÄúSo excited for you @NancyAKerrigan! Can‚Äôt wait to see you grace that ballroom floor, break a leg! #DWTS.‚Äù So excited for you @NancyAKerrigan ! Can't wait to see you grace that ballroom floor, break a leg! üíÉüèª #DWTS ‚Äî Kristi Yamaguchi (@kristiyamaguchi) March 20, 2017 Kerrigan was famously clubbed in the right knee in 1994, forcing her to withdraw from the U.S. Championships. The incident was linked to fellow skater Tonya Harding and the footage of Kerrigan clutching her leg and crying out, ‚ÄúWhy, why, why?‚Äù has become iconic in pop culture. But Kerrigan herself didn‚Äôt seem concerned by Yamaguchi‚Äôs word choice, replying to the tweet, ‚ÄúThank you so much Krisiti! I‚Äôm excited to get started said for the advice you had for me. This it‚Äôs a blast!‚Äù Just was looking at this, I am adjusting to new contacts... #oops ! Thank you @kristiyamaguchi for the advise! It definitely is helping! #dwts https://t.co/UPeeSFZ1xG ‚Äî Nancy Kerrigan (@NancyAKerrigan) March 22, 2017 She later clarified her tweet, writing, ‚ÄúJust looking at this, I am adjusting to new contact‚Ä¶ #oops! Thank you @kristiyamaguchi for the advise! It definitely is helping! #dwts.‚Äù
